abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            with project sustainability likely. The overall performance
            of both the World Bank and the Borrower are rated
            satisfactory. Lessons learned fro the project focused on the
            following: the crucial need of comprehensive and precise
            baseline data for monitoring impact; the critical role of
            the Block Resource Centers (BRCs) and Cluster Resource
            Centers (CRCs), in addition to state engagement in holistic
            planning for reform in education;  the importance of
            continuous evaluation and fine tuning of the supervision
            strategy; both the need for  reflection and a culture of
            learning from implementation experience to benefit project
            objectives; paying sustained attention to pedagogical
            reform; involving parents in student learning;   providing
            data on enrollment in private schools as integral to
            providing a complete picture of educational performance; and
            the need for understanding educational performance and
            policies in the country as a whole.

2848863.trustfund: TF022055-ENVIRONMENTAL INITIATIVE FOR ASIA/WID,TF025500-PHRD-BASIC EDUCATION PROJECT

repnme.cdata!: Delivering universal primary education in India

abstracts.cdata!:
In a nation as sprawling and diverse as
            India, offering even a few years of education to all boys
            and girls is a daunting prospect, but one that the
            government is confronting with the aid of the international
            community. Initiated in the early 1990s, the district
            primary education program (DPEP) was designed to facilitate
            India's efforts to achieve universal primary education
            and it has since become the world's largest education
            program, reaching 60 million children. The project also aims
            to reduce the number of school dropouts and improve the
            overall quality of primary education Enrollment in general
            has increased, and in a three-year period enrollment of
            girls increased to 43 percent from 38 percent.

docna.cdata!: Delivering universal primary education in India

display_title.display_title:
Delivering universal primary
            education in India

18156113.subsc: Sub-natl govt admin,Tertiary education,Primary education,Pre-primary education,Central government administration
18156113.theme: Rural services and infrastructure,Education for all,Social analysis and monitoring,Gender
18156113.trustfund: TF022055-ENVIRONMENTAL INITIATIVE FOR ASIA/WID,TF025500-PHRD-BASIC EDUCATION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
The District Primary Education Project
            will support the Government of India's District Primary
            Education Program to build national, state and district
            managerial and professional capacity for sustainable primary
            education development. The project includes three
            components: (a) building national institutional capacity to
            support, monitor and evaluate a national, decentralized
            primary education development program by establishing a
            strengthened framework for national management and
            professional technical assistance; (b) building state
            institutional capacity in six states to appraise, supervise
            and manage district-level projects and institutions for
            improving the quality and effectiveness of primary education
            and to provide techical support for program management,
            textbook development, improved teaching, improved planning
            and management and research and evaluation; and (c)
            improving quality and access in primary education in 23
            districts in 6 states through strengthened district
            institutional capacity, strengthened community participation
            and awareness, improved facilities, teacher in-service
            training, learning materials and teaching aids, targeted
            interventions for girls, scheduled caste and scheduled tribe
            students, early childhood education and construction of new
            schools and classrooms.
